entries.name: positive regulation of cell death
entries.def: Any process that increases the rate or frequency of cell death. Cell death is the specific activation or halting of processes within a cell so that its vital functions markedly cease, rather than simply deteriorating gradually over time, which culminates in cell death.

entries.name: leaf senescence
entries.def: The process that occurs in a leaf near the end of its active life that is associated with the dismantling of cell components and membranes, loss of functional chloroplasts, and an overall decline in metabolism.

entries.name: aerenchyma formation
entries.def: The process that gives rise to aerenchyma, parenchyma tissue containing particularly large intercellular spaces of schizogenous or lysigenous origin. This process pertains to the initial formation of a structure from unspecified parts.

entries.name: defense response to bacterium, incompatible interaction
entries.def: A response of an organism to a bacterium that prevents the occurrence or spread of disease.

entries.name: defense response to insect
entries.def: A response to protect an organism from a directly detected or perceived external threat from an insect or insects to that organism.

entries.name: response to hypoxia
entries.def: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating lowered oxygen tension. Hypoxia, defined as a decline in O2 levels below normoxic levels of 20.8 - 20.95%, results in metabolic adaptation at both the cellular and organismal level.

entries.name: detection of biotic stimulus
entries.def: The series of events in which a biotic stimulus, one caused or produced by a living organism, is received and converted into a molecular signal.

entries.name: detection of external stimulus
entries.def: The series of events in which an external stimulus is received by a cell and converted into a molecular signal.

entries.name: response to cold
entries.def: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a cold stimulus, a temperature stimulus below the optimal temperature for that organism.

entries.name: regulation of protein dephosphorylation
entries.def: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of removal of phosphate groups from a protein.

entries.name: negative regulation of defense response
entries.def: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of a defense response.

entries.name: regulation of hydrogen peroxide metabolic process
entries.def: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways involving hydrogen peroxide.

entries.name: jasmonic acid mediated signaling pathway
entries.def: A series of molecular signals mediated by jasmonic acid.

entries.name: systemic acquired resistance, salicylic acid mediated signaling pathway
entries.def: The series of molecular signals mediated by salicylic acid involved in systemic acquired resistance.

entries.name: MAPK cascade
entries.def: An intracellular protein kinase cascade containing at least a MAPK, a MAPKK and a MAP3K. The cascade can also contain two additional tiers: the upstream MAP4K and the downstream MAP Kinase-activated kinase (MAPKAPK). The kinases in each tier phosphorylate and activate the kinases in the downstream tier to transmit a signal within a cell.

entries.name: response to chitin
entries.def: A process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a chitin stimulus.

entries.name: salicylic acid biosynthetic process
entries.def: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of salicylic acid (2-hydroxybenzoic acid), a derivative of benzoic acid.

entries.name: respiratory burst involved in defense response
entries.def: A phase of elevated metabolic activity, during which oxygen consumption increases made as part of a defense response ; this leads to the production, by an NADH dependent system, of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2), superoxide anions and hydroxyl radicals.

entries.name: negative regulation of programmed cell death
entries.def: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of programmed cell death, cell death resulting from activation of endogenous cellular processes.

entries.name: defense response to fungus
entries.def: Reactions triggered in response to the presence of a fungus that act to protect the cell or organism.

entries.name: regulation of plant-type hypersensitive response
entries.def: Any endogenous process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the plant hypersensitive response.

entries.name: protein targeting to membrane
entries.def: The process of directing proteins towards a membrane, usually using signals contained within the protein.

entries.name: endoplasmic reticulum unfolded protein response
entries.def: The series of molecular signals generated as a consequence of the presence of unfolded proteins in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) or other ER-related stress; results in changes in the regulation of transcription and translation.

entries.name: triglyceride lipase activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the reaction: triacylglycerol + H2O = diacylglycerol + a carboxylate.

entries.name: abscisic acid-activated signaling pathway
entries.def: A series of molecular signals generated by the binding of the plant hormone abscisic acid (ABA) to a receptor, and ending with modulation of a cellular process, e.g. transcription.

entries.name: protein binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with any protein or protein complex (a complex of two or more proteins that may include other nonprotein molecules).

entries.name: regulation of transcription, DNA-templated
entries.def: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of cellular DNA-templated transcription.

entries.name: positive regulation of defense response to bacterium
entries.def: Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of defense response to bacterium.

entries.name: regulation of salicylic acid biosynthetic process
entries.def: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of salicylic acid.

entries.name: nucleus
entries.def: A membrane-bounded organelle of eukaryotic cells in which chromosomes are housed and replicated. In most cells, the nucleus contains all of the cell's chromosomes except the organellar chromosomes, and is the site of RNA synthesis and processing. In some species, or in specialized cell types, RNA metabolism or DNA replication may be absent.

entries.name: negative regulation of ethylene-activated signaling pathway
entries.def: Any process that stops or prevents ethylene (ethene) signal transduction.

entries.name: regulation of jasmonic acid mediated signaling pathway
entries.def: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of jasmonic acid mediated signaling pathway.

entries.name: transferase activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the transfer of a group, e.g. a methyl group, glycosyl group, acyl group, phosphorus-containing, or other groups, from one compound (generally regarded as the donor) to another compound (generally regarded as the acceptor). Transferase is the systematic name for any enzyme of EC class 2.

entries.name: cytoplasm
entries.def: All of the contents of a cell excluding the plasma membrane and nucleus, but including other subcellular structures.

entries.name: plant-type hypersensitive response
entries.def: The rapid, localized death of plant cells in response to invasion by a pathogen.

entries.name: lipid catabolic process
entries.def: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the breakdown of lipids, compounds soluble in an organic solvent but not, or sparingly, in an aqueous solvent.

entries.name: response to UV-C
entries.def: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a UV-C radiation stimulus. UV-C radiation (UV-C light) spans the wavelengths 100 to 280 nm.

entries.name: positive regulation of salicylic acid mediated signaling pathway
entries.def: Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of salicylic acid mediated signal transduction.

entries.name: positive regulation of defense response to insect
entries.def: Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of defense response to insect.

entries.name: positive regulation of camalexin biosynthetic process
entries.def: Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of camalexin biosynthetic process.

entries.name: ethylene-activated signaling pathway
entries.def: A series of molecular signals generated by the reception of ethylene (ethene, C2H4) by a receptor and ending with modulation of a cellular process, e.g. transcription.

entries.name: bounding membrane of organelle
entries.def: The lipid bilayer that forms the outer-most layer of an organelle.

entries.name: cellular response to trehalose stimulus
entries.def: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a trehalose stimulus.

entries.name: vascular leaf senescent stage
entries.def: A vascular leaf development stage (PO:0025570) that begins with the formation of a abscission zone at the base of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025) and ends with leaf separation and death.

entries.name: LP.02 two leaves visible stage
entries.def: The stage at which leaves at two nodes, other than the cotyledonary node, are visible above ground.

entries.name: petal differentiation and expansion stage
entries.def: Stage of corolla development defined by differentiation and expansion of petal.

entries.name: flowering stage
entries.def: A flower development stage (PO:0007615) that begins when pollen (PO:0025281) is released by anther dehiscence (GO:0009901) and/or the stigma (PO:0009073) is receptive and ends with the process of pollination (GO:0009856) and/or floral organ senescence (GO:0080187).

entries.name: plant embryo cotyledonary stage
entries.def: A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) that occurs during the interval between the beginning of rapid elongation of the plant embryo axis (PO:0019018) and plant embryo cotyledons (PO:0025470), and the onset of a plant embryo true leaf formation stage (PO:0001095), when present, or a mature plant embryo stage (PO:0001081).

entries.name: plant embryo bilateral stage
entries.def: A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) that occurs during the interval between the transition from radial to bilateral symmetry in a plant embryo proper (PO:0000001) and the onset of either the plant embryo cotyledonary stage (PO:0001078) or the plant embryo coleoptilar stage (PO:0001094).

entries.name: mature plant embryo stage
entries.def: A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) during the interval between when a plant embryo (PO:0009009) has stopped developmental growth involved in morphogenesis (GO:0060560) and one of the following: the beginning of the seed germination stage (PO:0007057) in seed plants, formation of the first vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in pteridophytes, the beginning of development of a sporangium (PO:0025094) in bryophytes, or the beginning of the formation of a plant organ (PO:0009008) such as a root (PO:0009005), shoot axis (PO:0025029), or vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in a cultured plant embryo (PO:0000010).

entries.name: LP.12 twelve leaves visible stage
entries.def: The stage at which leaves at twelve nodes, other than the cotyledonary node, are visible above ground.

entries.name: LP.08 eight leaves visible stage
entries.def: The stage at which leaves at eight nodes, other than the cotyledonary node, are visible above ground.

entries.name: LP.10 ten leaves visible stage
entries.def: The stage at which leaves at ten nodes, other than the cotyledonary node, are visible above ground.

entries.name: LP.04 four leaves visible stage
entries.def: The stage at which leaves at four nodes, other than the cotyledonary node, are visible above ground.

entries.name: LP.06 six leaves visible stage
entries.def: The stage at which leaves at six nodes, other than the cotyledonary node, are visible above ground.

entries.name: seed
entries.def: A multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025496) that develops from a plant ovule (PO:0020003) and has as parts a plant embryo (PO:0009009) enclosed in a seed coat (PO:0009088).

entries.name: plant embryo
entries.def: A whole plant (PO:0000003) that participates in the plant embryo stage (PO:0007631).

entries.name: cotyledon
entries.def: A vascular leaf (PO:0009025) formed at the first shoot node (PO:0005004) of a plant embryo (PO:0009009) or a seedling (PO:0000003).

entries.name: root
entries.def: A plant axis (PO:0025004) that lacks shoot axis nodes (PO:0005004), grows indeterminately, and is usually positively geotropic.

entries.name: stamen
entries.def: A microsporophyll bearing one or more microsporangia.

entries.name: sepal
entries.def: A phyllome (PO:0006001) that is usually green, and is part of the calyx (PO:0009060).

entries.name: petal
entries.def: A phyllome (PO:0006001) that is part of the corolla (PO:0009059), and is usually colored (not green).

entries.name: petiole
entries.def: A stalk of a leaf.

entries.name: cauline leaf
entries.def: A vascular leaf (PO:0009025), borne on the stem (PO:0009047).

entries.name: shoot apex
entries.def: A shoot axis (PO:0025029) that is the most distal part of a shoot system (PO:0009006) and has as parts a shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) and the youngest primordia (PO:0025127).

entries.name: inflorescence meristem
entries.def: A meristem that gives rise to an inflorescence.

entries.name: hypocotyl
entries.def: A stem internode (PO:0020142) below the cotyledonary node (PO:0025321) and transitional to a root (PO:0009005) of a plant embryo (PO:0009009) or a seedling (PO:0000003).

entries.name: leaf lamina base
entries.def: The region of the leaf lamina proximal to the stem and usually connected to it by means of a petiole.

entries.name: leaf apex
entries.def: A phyllome apex (PO:0025139) that is part of a leaf (PO:0025034).

entries.name: collective leaf structure
entries.def: A collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023) composed of two or more leaves (PO:0025034).
